diets that increases the production of black bile

Long_definition: variation of a pulse-beat felt only under one finger, which is marked by faint interruption

Short_definition: diets helping to gain body weight
diets producing obstructions in the body

Long_definition: the water purified through boiling which does not cause flatulence and passes out of the body quickly
the water obtained through condensation of the vapours produced after boiling
the water attributed to be odourless, tasteless, free from contamination and  light in weight, it passes down from stomach quickly and can easily be rendered hot or cold
water that contains natural salts in appreciable amount and induces diarrhoea, makes skin thin and dry and causes emaciation
an abnormal condition of pulse in which a large pulse becomes small and returns to the original height in a gradual manner

Short_definition: promotion and restoration of  health through air
Long_definition: maintenance of optimal health by ensuring the supply of good quality air and measures adopted to minimise the effect of polluted air

Term: Ḥifẓ al-Ṣiḥḥa bi Ḥasabi’l Awqāt al-Arba‘a
Short_definition: promotion and restoration of  health according to four seasons
Long_definition: application of regimens and modifications in daily  routine according to six essential factors and non-essential factors, e.g., exercise, purgation, venesection, emesis, etc., adopted to maintain the optimal health and to neutralize the non suitable  effects of seasonal changes and prevent from seasonal diseases

Short_definition: promotion and maintenance of  health through water intake
Long_definition: preservation of health by following the guidelines related to water intake, it includes timing of water intake, quantity and quality of water, avoiding water while taking food, during physical activity, bath, coitus and venesection, and drinking of water without thirst, etc.

Short_definition: promotion and maintenance of  health through diet
Long_definition: preservation of health by following the guidelines related to food intake, it includes timing of food intake, quantity and quality of food, daily requirement of food, sequencing  of different kind of  food, consideration of health status of organs, different habitats and physical activity, etc.

Term: Ḥifẓ al-Ṣiḥḥa bi’l Nawm wa’l Yaqẓa
Short_definition: promotion and maintenance of  health through sleep and wakefulness
Long_definition: preservation of health by following the guidelines related to sleep and wakefulness, it includes moderate, timely and sound sleep, proper posture during sleep and avoidance from excess sleep and wakefulness and sleep on full stomach

Short_definition: promotion and maintenance of  health through exercise
Long_definition: preservation of health through exercise, which revives the innate heat, increases the subtle heat, disperses and expels the accumulated harmful material from body, hardens the organs and renders them fit for their functions, improves nutrition, removes the harmful substances from lungs and strengthens the physique

Short_definition: promotion and maintenance of  health through massage
Long_definition: preservation of health through massage, which tones up the body, resolves the waste products, increases the innate heat, opens skin pores and relaxes the muscles

Short_definition: promotion and maintenance of  health through purgation
Long_definition: preservation of health through purgation, which evacuates the stagnated waste products and morbid humours from the body

Short_definition: promotion and maintenance of  health through emesis
Long_definition: preservation of health through emesis, which evacuates the waste products from the stomach and morbid humours from the upper part of the body

Short_definition: promotion and maintenance of  health through moderate coitus
Long_definition: preservation of health through coitus, which produces exhilaration, increases positivity, subsides sorrow, grief and anger, increases the thinking capacity, rejuvenates innate heat of the body, resolves the waste products, and is useful for all melancholic disorders
pulse in which the increase or decrease in any feature appears in such a gradual manner that the change can not be perceived

preventive healthcare of  pregnant woman and the foetus through various regimes, e.g., intake of diets which produce blood of thin consistency and  humours of good quality, intake of fruit juices, gentle exercise, good sleep, use of fragrance, balance state of mind and avoidance of diets having diuretic properties, etc.
measures  of promotion of health of lactating women, e.g., dietary regimens, management of common problems associated with breastfeeding, exercise, massage, cleanliness, etc.
guidelines, which include preference to mother's milk, breastfeeding twice or thrice a day, giving little honey to baby before breastfeeding, cradle song, etc.
modalities for new-borns to keep them healthy which includes proper cutting of umbilical cord, treatment of skin of baby with salted water, keeping them in airy room and proper bathing, etc.

Short_definition: promotion and maintenance of  health of infant after weaning
Long_definition: regimens, which include replacement of mother's milk with dietary substances, gentle exercise, application of oil on head and neck, rubbing of gums, taking care of hygiene of baby, etc.

regimens, including suitable dietary substances which produce humours of good quality, imbibing the qualities to control emotions; anger, fear, sorrow, etc., adoption of good habits, e.g., playing, massage,  light exercise, cleanliness and schooling, etc.

preservation of health through regimens, which include exercise, massage, evacuation of body from waste material according to season through venesection, purgation and intake of recommended dietary regimens

preservation of health during age of decline through regimens, which include cleansing of body from phlegm, intake of diet having hot and moist temperament, application of oil on body, avoiding heavy physical work, heavy exercise and black bile producing diets, etc.

preservation of health of elderly through regimens, which include intake of suitable diet and drinks, baths which render the body warm and moist, enough sleep,  moderate exercise and massage and application of oil, etc.

restoration of health of a person recovering from illness by strengthening innate heat and organs, gradual increase in dietary intake, mild exercise, application of oils producing moistness and avoidance from anger, heat, coitus, etc.
pulse, which varies according to a definite order

Short_definition: promotion and maintenance of  health through selection of place of residence
Long_definition: factors to be taken into account while selecting a place of residence, it include quality of soil, height, area covered with trees or exposed to sky, quality of water, quality of air, condition of neighbouring areas, quality of construction, ventilation, amount of light, temperature, climate, etc.
guidelines for travellers include precautionary measures to be taken into consideration while travelling

Short_definition: promotion and restoration of health of land traveller
Long_definition: specific guidelines for land travellers which include special dietary regimens, recommendations about quality of water, practice of reduced sleep, long fasting, avoidance form heat, precautions against thirst, fatigue, sunstroke, frostbite,  etc.

Short_definition: promotion and restoration of health of traveller by sea
Long_definition: specific guidelines for sea traveller which include special dietary regimens, measures to prevent sea sickness, management of vertigo, nausea, vomiting, etc.

Short_definition: promotion and restoration of health through hot bath/turkish bath
Long_definition: use of turkish bath in routine life, which prevents the accumulation of morbid humours, resolves the waste products of the body, increases the innate heat and has the digestive, detergent, excretory effects, etc.

Short_definition: promotion and restoration of health of organs
Long_definition: maintenance of health of organs by following certain guidelines and adopting specific measures and regimens

preservation of healthy status of hair through various measures which include application of oils to prevent hair fall, application of moisture producing oils to prevent the split, curling and breaking of hair; application of oils that promote hair growth, washing with suitable liquid preparations to remove dandruff and irritation; evacuation of predominant matters from brain and avoidance from phlegm producing things, etc.

Short_definition: maintenance of head in a healthy condition
Long_definition: preservation of healthy status of head through various measures which include habitual combing, cleansing of dirt and removal of lice by washing, avoiding the stuff  which causes production of gases, evacuation with suitable drugs, habitual emesis if there is the accumulation of phlegm in the stomach and inhalation of suitable fragrant materials

preservation of eyes through various measures which include local application of eye tonic antimony, washing of eyes by lukewarm purified water, evacuation of brain and avoidance from gas producing substances, salty and spicy diets, dust and smoke, staying in relatively hot temperature, inordinate sleep and wakefulness, excessive coitus, prolonged exposure to bright objects, eye strain, excessive crying, overeating, etc.
preservation of the health of nose through various measures which include cleansing of nostrils, drawing up the lukewarm water through nostrils and application of some suitable oil occasionally
pulse in which only one irregularity is repeated

preservation of the health of ear through various measures which include its cleansing, instilling few drops of bitter almond oil, hearing of pleasant sounds and avoidance from high pitched sound, extremely hot or cold temperature, dust and violent wind

preservation of healthy status of the tongue through various measures which include its repeated washing, rinsing with lukewarm water, intake of diets having sweet and fatty taste and avoidance from excessive talking and intake of distasteful foods, e.g., bitter, salty, spicy and sour items

Short_definition: maintenance of teeth in a healthy condition
Long_definition: preservation of healthy status of teeth through various measures which include avoidance from intake of sour diets, breaking of hard things with teeth, chewing of gummy materials, intake of hot things after cold things or vice versa and things which cause decay of teeth

Term: Ḥifẓ Ṣiḥḥa al-Ri’a wa Qaṣaba al-Ri’a
RegionalTerm: حفظ صحۃ الریۃ و قصبۃ الریۃ
Short_definition: maintenance of health of lungs and trachea
Long_definition: preservation of healthy status of lungs and trachea through various measures which include talking with moderate tone, expulsion of material coming to them from brain or lower part of body and application of some tonic or resolvent oils on chest
preservation of healthy status of heart through various measures including use of refrigerants and avoidance from distress and anxiety

preservation of healthy status of stomach through various measures, which include emesis on regular basis, use of suitable drug formulations, local application of fragrant tonic oils and keeping away from flatulent food and impure water
preservation of healthy status of intestine through avoidance from flatulent foodstuff
preservation of healthy status of liver through various measures which include use of deobstruent things, little use of sweets and avoiding physical activity and bathing after taking the food

Short_definition: maintenance of health of organs of the urinary system
Long_definition: preservation of healthy status of organs of urinary system through various measures which include use of diuretic substances on regular interval, cleansing of urinary tract, emesis and avoidance from the intake of impure water
preservation of healthy status of joints through various measures including emesis, purgation, moderate movement and local application of oil occasionally
pulse, in which two or more irregularities go on repeating in cycles
voluntary prevention of conception
measures adopted to prevent conception  which include use of oral contraceptive drugs, local use of drugs and measures etc.

Debility of organs is caused by deficiency of power/ pneuma/  temperament derangement /composition derangement of organs  ; Apart from these immediate causes, debility of organs can also be due to pain, fevers, excessive humger etc.
Insufficiency of heat of the body regulated by medicatrix naturae to maintain the life which resulting in overall decrease of health.
a feeling of tiredness or exhaustion or of experiencing a loss of strength

Derangement of faculty which is furnished in an individual for the sensory/perceptive and motor/motive function of the body, it controls the nervous tissues to perform the functions of sensation/perception and regulates the nervous system for motor activity
Derangement of faculty, which is essential for life and reaches from heart to the body organs through arteries and keeps them alive
Derangement of faculty serving the functions of nutrition, growth, reproduction and evacuation of waste products from the body for the preservation of individual as well as species
Derangement of power/faculty making alteration in the food  in such a manner that it becomes temperamentally similar to the body and suitable to replace the daily wear and tear
Derangement of power/faculty which selects and collects the matter for digestion
pulse, which does not vary according to a definite order
Derangement of power/faculty which attaches the digested matter to the organs for their nutrition

Derangement of power/faculty, which transforms the matter attached to  the organ by adhesive faculty  in such a way that it resembles the nourished organ in all respects and becomes a part of that organ
Derangement of power/faculty, which develops the organs in the required form and size and integrates the nutrient material to complete the individual development
Derangement of power/faculty,  which serves the nutritive faculty and absorbs the beneficial material into the organs
Derangement of power/faculty,  which serves the nutritive faculty and retains the dietary material in organs till the digestive faculty completes its work
Derangement of power/faculty,  which serves the nutritive faculty and digests the dietary material to make it a part of an organ
Derangement of power/faculty,  which serves the nutritive faculty and expels the waste products from orgns outside the body
Derangement of primary physical faculties provided to an individual for preservation of its species

Short_definition: Hot and moist predominant temperament age pattern
Long_definition: It extends from  birth up to  thirty years and is characterized  by vulnerability  to disorders related to teething, mouth ulcers, cough, vomiting, inflammation of umbilicus, diarrhea, spasms, worm infestation, abscesses, pharyngitis, lymphadenopathies etc

Short_definition: Hot predominant temperament with lesser degree of moistness age pattern
Long_definition: It  extends  from thirty to forty years of age is characterized by vulnerability  to disorders like haemoptysis, epilepsy, fevers, phthisis, etc.
The moistness of an organ which remains in equilibrium, qualitatively and quantitatively, in accordance to the temperament of that organ.
pulse having rhythm in accordance with the age of person

Short_definition: Cold and dry predominant temperament age pattern
Long_definition: It  extends  from forty to sixty years of age is characterized by vulnerability  to bronchial asthma, pleurisy, inflammation of lungs, fever accompanied with insomnia, fever accompanied with delirium, Hectic fever, prolonged loose motions, lienteric diarrhea, intestinal abrasions, rupture of blood vessels

Short_definition: Cold predominant temperament with greater degree of dryness age pattern
Long_definition: It extends from sixty years of age onwards and is characterized by vulnerability to respiratory disorders, joint pain, vertigo, unconsciousness, insomnia, diminished vision, diminished hearing, delayed healing ulcers

Short_definition: Pattern of disorders in initial stage of pregnancy
Long_definition: In this period there is vulnerability to disorders like restlessness, fatigue, heaviness of body, nausea, sour eructus and palpitation

Short_definition: Pattern of disorders in midstage of pregnancy
Long_definition: In this period there is vulnerability to disorders like pica, melasma, discolouration of skin, haziness of white portion of eyes, etc.

Short_definition: Pattern of disorders in last stage of pregnancy
Long_definition: In this period there is vulnerability to disorders like bleeding per vagina, constipation, loss of appetite, vaginal itching, palpitation, etc.

Short_definition: Pattern of disorders in post partum period
Long_definition: This pattern extends till 40 days after delivery. In this period there is vulnerability to disorders like fever, palpitation, pain in uterus, burning micturition, delirium, melancholia, etc
A condition in which there is thickening or increased viscosity of body fluids
A condition in which there is decreased viscosity of body fluids
This is a morbid moistness produced by the disturbance of metabolism and this moistness dominate the innate heat resulting in its dimunition.
child birth after completion of  gestation period.
pulse having rhythm which is not in  accordance with the age of person

Short_definition: rhythm of the pulse similar to that of person of adjacent age group
Long_definition: pulse, which acquires the rhythm of the pulse of person belonging to adjacent age group, e.g., rhythm of a child’s pulse becomes that of the pulse of a young man

Short_definition: rhythm of the pulse similar to that of person not belonging to adjacent age group
Long_definition: pulse, which acquires the rhythm of the pulse of person not belonging to adjacent age group, e.g., rhythm of a child’s pulse corresponds to that of an old man’s pulse
pulse whose rhythm does not match any age
pulse, irregular in two or more features
compound pulse, which starts from smallness, increases up to a certain limit, starts declining and comes back to the original position
compound pulse, in which pause occurs where the movement is expected
compound pulse, in which an extra beat appears during the period of rest after the first beat has ended
compound pulse, which is considered to be single beat by some physicians and coupled beat by others
The innate heat of the body regulated by medicatrix naturae for the normal functioning of the body.
compound pulse which gradually increases or decreases in one or more features of the beats
mouse tail pulse, which is irregular in the expansion of the beat and starts as large pulse but does not end on a definite limit of smallness
mouse tail pulse, which starts as large pulse and ends as small pulse
mouse tail pulse, which starts as large pulse and ends as small pulse thereafter rebounds to the state of large pulse
compound pulse which has its beats sluggish in initial phase but later on it suddenly becomes quick
slow rising pulse
compound pulse similar to wavy pulse but is small and rapid
compound pulse smaller and more rapid than the vermicular pulse. In this kind of pulse height and length are more affected than the width in comparison of vermicular pulse
compound pulse resembling wavy pulse but firm and hard in nature
compound pulse, in which there are repeated jerky movements similar to spasm
The term used for the process of digestion and transformation of the food particles to become the parts of the body.
compound pulse, which is feeble and trembling
compound pulse which seems similar to thread being twisted
compound pulse which is a variety of  twisting pulse but resembles the tremulous pulse
urine, which indicates some degree of heat in comparison of normal urine
colour of urine that resembles with the peel of orange but the red colour is more prominent as compared to reddish-yellow urine and indicates higher degree of heat
colour of urine that  resembles with the saffron-soaked water and indicates higher degree of heat in comparison of orange-yellow coloured urine
colour of urine that  resembles with the filaments of saffron and indicates higher degree of heat in comparison of reddish-yellow, orange-yellow and flame-yellow urine
urine indicating predominance of sanguine in the body
urine indicating predominance of sanguine in the body
urine indicating predominance of sanguine in the body
The four different types of digestion i.e. Haḍm Mi‘dī, Haḍm Kabidī, Haḍm ‘Urūqī, Haḍm ‘Uḍwī which the food particles have to go through for the purpose of assimilation in the body.
The first stage of food digestion which occurs inside the alimentary canal to form chime.
The second stage of food digestion which takes place at the site of liver to form chyle.
The third stage of digestion which takes place inside the vessels. This helps in the assimilation of food so that it becomes the part of the body.
The fourth stage of digestion which takes place in the organs.
urine indicating predominance of sanguine in the body
yellow-coloured urine mixed with little bit of black colour, which indicates predominance of cold in the body
urine, which indicates the extreme combustion within the body
urine, which indicates extremely cold morbid temperament
urine, which indicates cold morbid temperament
urine, which indicates extreme combustion within the body but is less risky than verdigris-green urine
urine, which denotes extreme combustion of humours, extreme cold, extinction of the innate heat and evacuation of melancholic wastes by the medicatrix naturae after crisis
a type of urine, which may  be transparent or translucent
white-coloured transparent urine, which denotes coldness of temperament and defective maturation
white-coloured urine which resembles milk and is viscous in nature
Pattern of humoral derangement
Pattern of temperament derangement
Pattern of excretory product derangement
Pattern of constitution derangement
Pattern of pulse derangement
Pattern of causes
Pattern of intervention
Pattern miscellenous
Miscellaneous disorders

Short_definition:
diseases with severe signs and
symptoms
Long_definition: diseases which reach their peak commonly on fourth day, their signs and symptoms are severe but does not exceed twenty days
stages/ phases of a disease in its due course
that stage during which the disease  manifests itself and its characters start to develop

Short_definition: stage of advancement/ time of increase of a disease
Long_definition: the stage during which an increment in the degree of illness takes place

Short_definition: stage of culmination/peak of a disease
Long_definition: the stage during which all the characters of the illness attain a stage of standstill after reaching their peak, before the time of decline

Short_definition: stage of decline of a disease
Long_definition: stage of disease in which signs and symptoms of illness start to decline

Short_definition: shifting of morbid matter from the site of disease to another site
Long_definition: shifting of morbid matter from the diseased organ/ part to the other organ

Short_definition: the diseases which have a slow onset, longer duration and lesser severity
Long_definition: the diseases which have a slow onset, longer duration and lesser severity and reaching their peak over a long duration

Short_definition: the diseases which appear externally on the body
Long_definition: the diseases which appear externally on the body and can be diagnosed commonly by general physical examination e.g. diseases of skin, nails, hair etc.

Short_definition: diseases, which are not evident externally and occur inside the body
Long_definition: diseases, which are not evident externally, as they occur inside the body. Such disease can not be diagnosed merely by general physical examination

Short_definition: the diseases which are associated with particular organ
Long_definition: the diseases which are associated with particular organs e.g. blindness with eyes and deafness with ears

Short_definition: disease of an organ due to disease of another organ, as both are interconnected
Long_definition: one organ shares the disease with another, because both are interconnected, such as the brain and the stomach are interconnected through nerves

Short_definition: infectious diseases that transmit from one person to another
Long_definition: some of the diseases are infectious such as leprosy, scabies, small-pox, epidemic fever, and putrid ulcer. They commonly occur when the houses are congested and the neighbouring area is low lying, etc.

Short_definition: diseases, continuing from one generation to another
diseases which are peculiar to a race, tribe or people of a region
Tumour of breast due to vali
Long_definition: It is characterized by breast abcess. It is explained by increased vali. Among seven udalthathukkal Cāram, Cennīr and Ūṉ gets affected.
It is characterized by breast abcess. It is explained by increased Aẕal. Among the body constituents ,Cāram, Cennīr and Ūṉ gets affected

Short_definition: Tumour of breast due to kabam
Long_definition: It is characterized by breast abcess. It is explained by derangement of iyam. Among the body constituents Cāram, Cennīr and Ūṉ gets affected.

Short_definition: Tumour of breast due to mukkutram
Long_definition: It is characterized by abcess in the breast. It is explained by increased vali, Aẕal and iyam. Among seven udal thathukkal saram ,Cennīr and Ūṉ gets affected.

Short_definition: Tumour of breast due to injury
Long_definition: It is characterized by abcess or lump due to injury. It is explained by increased vali, Aẕal and iyam. In the body constituents Cāram, Cennīr and Ūṉ gets affected.

Short_definition: Cancer occuring in Sclera classified under Mukkutram

Long_definition: It is characterized by abcess in the size of rosary pea in the scelera of eye . It is explained increased vali, Aẕal and iyam. Among seven udal thathukkal saram ,Cennīr and Ūṉ gets affected.

Short_definition: Abcess in cornea with skin tag
Long_definition: It is characterized by abcess in the scelera with reddish inflammation. It is explained by increased iyam. Among seven udal thathukkal saram ,Cennīr and Ūṉ gets affected.
It is characterized by raised abcess in the scelera. It is explained by increased iyam. Among seven udal thathukkal saram ,Cennīr and Ūṉ gets affected.

It is characterized by head ache, abdominal distension, pain in lower abdomen, constipation and dryness of skin. It is explained by increased vali, Aẕal and iyam.Among seven udal thathukkal saram ,Cennīr and Ūṉ gets affected.

It is characterized by pain in the spine, ribs, anal and genital regions, discharge of pus and blood and the body becomes flaccid. It is explained by increased vali, Aẕal and iyam.Among seven udal thathukkal saram ,Cennīr and Ūṉ gets affected.

It is characterized by hematemesis, itching all over the body, yawning, tastelessness, mental confusion and abdominal discomfort. It is explained by increased vali, Aẕal and iyam.Among seven udal thathukkal saram ,Cennīr and Ūṉ gets affected.

It is characterized tumor in the abdomen, tightness in the chest and dizziness in the eyes. It is explained by increased vali, Aẕal and iyam.Among seven udal thathukkal saram ,Cennīr and Ūṉ gets affected.

It is characterized by abcess all over the body with accumulation of blood,spreading into bones and tingling sensation in the skin. It is explained by increased vali, Aẕal and iyam.Among seven udal thathukkal saram ,Cennīr and Ūṉ gets affected.

It is characterized by phlegm in the chest, sweet taste in saliva, edema in the body and green coloured stools. It is explained by increased vali, Aẕal and iyam.Among seven udal thathukkal saram ,Cennīr and Ūṉ gets affected.

It is characterized by protruding tissue, bitterness in mouth, hiccough, abdominal discomfort and thickness of the tongue. It is explained by increased vali, Aẕal and iyam. Among seven udal thathukkal saram ,Cennīr and Ūṉ gets affected.

It is characterized by increased menorrhagia , vaginal discharge ,followed by foul odour,post coital bleeding , low back pain , retention of urine and stools. It is explained by derangement of muththathukkal . Among the seven udal thathukkal , Cāram , C

It is characterized by blood tinged unusual vaginal discharge , pain during intercourse , pain during urination It is explained by derangement of muththathukkal . Among the seven udal thathukkal , Cāram , Cennīr,Ūṉ,kozhupu,Eṉpu,Mūḷai,Cukkilam get affec
Signs and symptoms

Short_definition: signs and symptoms not specific for a disease condition
Long_definition: signs and symptoms not specific to a disease, like headache may be developed with fever and without fever

Short_definition: signs and symptoms of external diseases
Long_definition: signs and symptoms of external diseases that can be detected by specific sensory organ or combination of sensory organs

Short_definition: signs and symptoms of internal diseases
Long_definition: signs and symptoms of internal diseases like disease of liver, disease of lungs etc.

Short_definition: signs of the disease that indicate its present condition
signs and symptoms of distension/ retention of flatus
Long_definition: signs and symptoms of distension commonly in the abdomen, which are pain, movement and sound due to flatus and feeling of flatus by touch
these include  heaviness, loss of function, increased temperature and pain, if found in pain sensitive organ

Short_definition: signs and symptoms of loss of continuity
Long_definition: these include  pain, discharge and signs and symptoms  vary according to every organ
heaviness in the whole body is a feature of predominance of sanguine
heaviness of the head is usual symptom of predominance of sanguine
heaviness in the eyes  is a usual symptom of predominance of sanguine
heaviness in the temporal region is a symptom of predominance of sanguine

Short_definition: breaking/ aching pain in the body
Long_definition: feeling of pain and breaking of organs of the body, is a symptom of predominance of sanguine
flabbiness/ softness of the body i.e. loose, soft and fleshy body is a symptom of  predominance of phlegm

Short_definition: feeling of dullness/ sluggishness of the body
Long_definition: feeling of dullness and tiredness of the body, is the symptom of    predominance of phlegm

Short_definition: symptoms of the disease showing previous condition of the disease
Long_definition: symptoms of the disease showing previous condition of the disease. Inference drawn by the physician from the existing signs and symptoms of the patient about previous disease condition helps the physician arriving at correct diagnosis; it also indicates the authority of the physician on the subject matter and his clinical practices, it also increases the confidence of a patient on the physician
looseness of the nerve is a symptom of  predominance of phlegm

Short_definition: whitish colouration of the body / excessive pallor of the body
Long_definition: whitish colouration of the body/ excessive pallor of the body is a sign of predominance of phlegm
feeling of softness of the body is a sign of predominance of phlegm
yellowish colouration is a feature of predominance of yellow bile
yellowish discolouration of face is a sign of bilious predominance
yellow discoloration of eyes, is a sign of  bilious predominance
bitter taste in the mouth, is a symptom of  bilious predominance
roughness of the tongue, is a symptom of  bilious predominance
feeling pleasure with cold breeze is a feature of predominance of yellow bile
excessive dryness of the body in which body seems droughty is a feature of predominance of black bile

Short_definition: symptoms of the disease indicating future condition/ prognois of the disease
Long_definition: symptoms of the disease indicating future condition and prognosis of the disease. It helps the patient as well as physician to adopt the preventive measures. It also develops the confidence of the patient on the clinical expertise of the physician
swarthy/dusky complexion  of the body, is a feature of predominance of black bile
blackish/brown/ dark colouration of the body, is a feature of predominance of black bile
excess of obsessive thoughts is a feature of predominance of black bile

Short_definition: burning sensation at cardiac end of the stomach
Long_definition: burning sensation of chest due to the  movement of secretion of stomach toward oesophagus

Short_definition: feeling of heat in the head
feeling of heaviness in the head
feeling of tension in the head

Term: Mayl al-Ṣudā‘ ilā Shiqq al-Ra’s al-Ayman
RegionalTerm: میل الصداع الی شق الرأس الایمن

Term: Mayl al-Ṣudā‘ ilā Shiqq al-Ra’s al-Aysar
RegionalTerm: میل الصداع الی شق الرأس الایسر

Short_definition: signs and symptoms of the disease
Long_definition: signs and symptoms related to disease may be characteristic feature of particular disease or may indicate location of disease or cause of the disease

Short_definition: whitish discolouration of skin of head
signs of structure of the organ
Long_definition: signs pertaining to the structure, position, numbers,  quantity of the organ either in health or disease

Short_definition: exacerbation of headache following the intake of liquor

Long_definition: signs of the external appearance of the organ, and not directly related to structure of the organ pertaining to the beauty of the organ

Short_definition: signs of structure and function of the organ
Long_definition: signs of the structure of the organ pertaining to its functional ability

Short_definition: signs and symptoms specific for the period of the disease
Long_definition: signs and symptoms that persists for a specific condition, starts with a disease and ends as the diseases ends e.g. high grade fever, breathlessness, stabbing chest pain are specific to pleurisy

Short_definition: Anaemia caused by increased vali, lower abdominal pain,engorged veins
Long_definition: This is characterised by abdominal pain, thirst, anorexia, engorged veins. Redness of eyes, pallor & edema with pain, borboygmus & constipation. It can be explained by increased vali (vyanan,abanan & nagan) affecting Aẕal. Among the seven udal thathukkal

Short_definition: Anaemia caused by increased Azhal, Severe pallor,dyspnoea on exertion
Long_definition: This is characterised by yellowish discoloration of tongue, pallor of upper limb and lower limb, dimness of vision, intense thirst, giddiness, spicy or bitter taste in the tongue taste, constriction of the chest, dyspnoeic with giddiness. Likeness toward

This is characterized by distention of the abdomen, dyspepsia, vomiting, diarrhoea, fever, worm infestation, emaciation, anaemic, pallor and palpitation.This is common in childhood,pregnancy due to pica.This can be explained by derangement of vali influe

Short_definition: Anaemia caused by increased Aiyam, haemolytic anaemia
Long_definition: This is characterised by pallor of the body proportionate to the intake of toxic substances. Intense thirst, tasteless, vomitting, hiccough, cough, dyspnoea, anasarca,engorged veins,increase in body heat. It is explained by increased mukkuttram that affec

Short_definition: Anaemia caused by increased Aiyam, salt taste in tongue,cough syncope
Long_definition: This is characterised by pallor, engorged veins, salty taste, vomiting, cough withexpectoration, giddiness, lumbago and impotence. It is explained by increased kapha, influencing vali that affects udanan. Among seven udal thathukkal saram ,Cennīr, Ūṉ, Eṉp

This is characterised by anorexia,thirst,dyspnoea,increased micturition,weakness in the chest,increased bodyheat,anasarca,malaise.This can be explained by deranged mukuttram affects udanan,vyanan. Among the seven udal thathukkal saram to veneer is affecte

Short_definition: Rectal prolapse due to increasing Vali
Long_definition: It is characterized by rectal prolapse to a degree where they protrude out the anus and visible due to chronic diarrhoea, dysentry and increased rectal pressure followed by constipation. It is explained by increased vali. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ

Short_definition: Axillary lymphadenopathy due to increasing Azhal
Long_definition: It is characterized by axillary lymphadenitis, sometimes fever and convalesence. It is explained by increased Aẕal. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram, Cennīr and Ūṉ gets affected.

Short_definition: Diabetic carbuncle present in head due to increasing azhal
Long_definition: It is characterized by swollen carbuncles under the scalpy skin with painful cluster of furuncle, thirst, fever and pricking pain. It is explained by increased Aẕal. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram, Cennīr, Ūṉ and Koẕuppu gets affected.

Short_definition: Occipital Carbuncle due to increasing Azhal
Long_definition: It is characterized by swollen carbuncle under the thoracic or lumbar vertebral area with burning sensation, pricking pain, painful cluster of furuncle. It is explained by increased Aẕal. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram, Cennīr, Ūṉ and Koẕuppu gets

Short_definition: Head Carbuncle due to increasing Azhal
Long_definition: It is characterized by a carbuncle in the head with redness of the face, ulcer and spasmodic pain. It is explained by increased Aẕal. Among the seven udarthadhukal Cāram, Cennīr, Ūṉ and Koẕuppu gets affected.

Short_definition: Blisters present in the Face due to increasing Aiyam
Long_definition: It is characterized by blisters present in the face and head with watery discharge, redness and ulcer with pricking pain. It is explained by increased Aẕal. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram, Cennīr, Ūṉ and Koẕuppu gets affected.

Short_definition: Boils around the head due to increasing Azhal
Long_definition: It is characterized by blisters around the head with pricking pain, burning sensation in the eyes and ears. It is explained by increased Aẕal. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram, Cennīr and Ūṉ gets affected.

Short_definition: Head Carbuncle due to increasing aiyam
Long_definition: It is characterized by swollen carbuncle in the scalp with pricking pain present all over the body, thirst, dyspnoea. It is explained by increased aiyam along with Aẕal. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram, Cennīr, Ūṉ, Koẕuppu gets affected.

Short_definition: Scalp Blisters due to increasing aiyam
Long_definition: It is characterized by carbuncle in the scalp with fever, painful micturation, dyspnoea and hiccup. It is explained by increased aiyam along with Aẕal. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram, Cennīr, Ūṉ, Koẕuppu gets affected.

It is characterized by carbuncle in the scalp with papules, pain, burning sensation, puffiness in the face and remittent fever. It is explained by increased aiyam along with Aẕal. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram, Cennīr, Ūṉ and Koẕuppu gets affected.

It is characterized by blisters around the eyes with accumulation of pus, oozing and pricking pain. It is explained by increased aiyam. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram, Cennīr, Ūṉ and Koẕuppu gets affected.

It is characterized by carbuncle in the scalp with blood accumulated multiple papules and cracked skin. It is explained by increased aiyam. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram, Cennīr, Ūṉ, Koẕuppu gets affected.

Short_definition: Scalp eczema due to increasing Vali
Long_definition: It is characterized by heaviness of the head, swollen eyes, hair loss, dry skin and nasal bleeding. It is explained by increased Aẕal. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram, Cennīr, Ūṉ and Koẕuppu gets affected.

Short_definition: Cervical Lymphadenopathy due to derangement of mukkutram
Long_definition: It is characterized by cervical lymphadenitis which is pitting in nature, itching. It is explained by increased vali, and aiyam. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram, Cennīr, Ūṉ and Koẕuppu gets affected.

Short_definition: Conical shaped Diabetic Carbuncle due to Increasing Vali
Long_definition: It is characterized by conical shaped diabetic carbuncle in the joints and muscular regions of the body. It is explained by increased vali. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram, Cennīr and Ūṉ gets affected.

Short_definition: Boils spreading like trees root due to increasing Vali
Long_definition: It is characterized by black coloured diabetic blisters present in sunken area of the body, difficulty to bend the hip. It is explained by increased vali. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram, Cennīr and Ūṉ gets affected.

Short_definition: Blisters present in sunken area of the body due to spreading the vali
Long_definition: It is characterized by conical shaped diabetic carbuncle present in the joints and muscular regions. It is explained by increased vali. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram, Cennīr and Ūṉ gets affected.

Short_definition: Blisters like ground nut shaped due to increasing Vali
Long_definition: It is characterized by ground nut shaped diabetic blisters spreading all over the body. It is explained by increased vali. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram, Cennīr and Ūṉ gets affected.

Short_definition: Blisters like lentils due to increasing Vali
Long_definition: It is characterized by diabetic blisters like lentils with pain. It is explained by increased vali. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram, Cennīr and Ūṉ gets affected.

Short_definition: Blisters like bottle gourd shaped due to increasing Vali
Long_definition: It is characterized by diabetic blisters like bottle gourd shape with burning sensation, fever, thurst, boils. It is explained by increased Aẕal. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram, Cennīr and Ūṉ gets affected.

Short_definition: Multiple Blisters due to increasing Azhal
Long_definition: It is characterized by multiple blisters with burning sensation and pain. It is explained by increased Aẕal. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram, Cennīr, Ūṉ and Koẕuppu gets affected.

Short_definition: Multiple diabetic carbuncle due to increasing Azhal
Long_definition: It is characterized by multiple diabetic carbuncles. It is explained by increased Aẕal. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram, Cennīr and Ūṉ gets affected.

Short_definition: Tortoise shell like Diabetic carbuncle due to increasing Aiyam
Long_definition: It is characterized by tortoise shell like diabetic carbuncle with pain and swelling. It is explained by increased aiyam. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram, Cennīr and Ūṉ gets affected.

Short_definition: carbuncle like tuber due to increasing Aiyam
Long_definition: It is characterized by diabetic carbuncle like tuber with pain It is explained by increased aiyam. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram, Cennīr, Ūṉ, Koẕuppu gets affected.

Short_definition: Syphilitic ulcer due to increasing Vali
Long_definition: It is characterized by a chancre with bleeding and pricking pain. It is explained by increased vali. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram, Cennīr and Ūṉ gets affected.

Short_definition: Syphilitic ulcer due to altered Oon thathu by increasing Kabam
Long_definition: It is characterized by chancre with fleshy wound. It is explained by increased vali. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram, Cennīr and Ūṉ gets affected.

Short_definition: Syphilitic ulcer due to altered Enbu thathu by increasing vali
Long_definition: It is characterized by chancre with raised margin caused by trauma, bone fracture. It is explained by increased vali . Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram, Cennīr, Ūṉ, Koẕuppu and Eṉpu gets affected.

Short_definition: Multiple spreading syphilitic ulcer due to increasing Vali
Long_definition: It is characterized by chancre with inflammation of the nerve, accumulation of the blood caused by cold water bath, rich salt food intake. It is explained by increased vali . Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram, Cennīr and Ūṉ gets affected.

Short_definition: Syphilitic ulcer due to increasing azhal
Long_definition: It is characterized by chancre with reddish or yellowish discolouration and burning sensation. It is explained by increased Aẕal . Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram, Cennīr and Ūṉ gets affected.

Short_definition: Syphilitic ulcer due to increasing aiyam
Long_definition: It is characterized by chancre associated with paller, thickened skin with itching. It is explained by increased aiyam. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram, Cennīr and Ūṉ gets affected.

Short_definition: Syphilitic ulcer due to altered Kozhuppu thathu by increasing Kabam
Long_definition: It is characterized by chancre with oozing pus due to rich fat intake. It is explained by increased aiyam. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram, Cennīr, Ūṉ and Koẕuppu gets affected.

Short_definition: Syphilitic wound due to affected by increasing Vali
Long_definition: It is characterized by syphilitic wound. It is explained by increased aiyam . Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram, Cennīr andf Ūṉ gets affected.

Short_definition: Syphilitic ulcer due to altered Senneer thathu by increasing Azhal
Long_definition: It is characterized by a chancre with bleeding and burning sensation. It is explained by all the mukkutram get affected . Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram, Cennīr and Ūṉ gets affected.

Short_definition: Heaviness of Head classified under Vali
Heaviness of the head due increasing Vali
Long_definition: It is characterized by heaviness in head associated with blurred vision, pain in the occipital region, puffiness of the face. It is explained by increased vali. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram, Cennīr gets affected.

Short_definition: Heaviness of the head associated with blood infection
Long_definition: It is characterized by heaviness in head associated with fever, pain in the occipital and frontal region, puffiness of the face, swelling of the eyeball. It is explained by increased vali . Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram and Cennīr gets affected.

Short_definition: Heaviness of Head classified under Aiyam
Heaviness of the head due increasing Aiyam
Long_definition: It is characterized by heaviness in head associated with hair loss, head ache. It is explained by increased aiyam. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram and Cennīr gets affected.

Short_definition: Pricking pain around the head due to increasing Vali
Long_definition: It is characterized by pricking pain around the head with severe pain in the occipital region. It is explained by increased vali. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram, Cennīr and Ūṉ gets affected.

Short_definition: Delirium caused by diseases of head
Extreme coldness of Head classified under Mukkutram
Delirium caused by diseases of head
Long_definition: It is characterized by delirium with headache, hyperhydrosis, giddiness, nausea, vomitting. It is explained by altered vali, Aẕal and aiyam. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram, Cennīr gets affected.

Short_definition: Scalp pain caused by increased Vali
Long_definition: It is characterized by pain in the scalp associated with tinnitus, dryness of the nostrils, discolouration of the face. It is explained by increased vali. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram and Cennīr gets affected.

Short_definition: Scalp pain caused by blood infection
Long_definition: It is characterized by pain in the scalp associated with bad odour, hair loss, puffiness of the face. It is explained by increased vali. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram and Cennīr gets affected.

Short_definition: Scalp pain and swelling around the neck
Long_definition: It is characterized by pain in the scalp associated with rhinitis, nasal obstruction, boils in the scalp. It is explained by increased vali. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram and Cennīr gets affected.

Short_definition: Numbness over Scalp classified under Vali
Numbness over Scalp caused by increased Vali
Long_definition: It is characterized by numbness around the head associated with hair loss. It is explained by increased vali. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram and Cennīr gets affected.
It is characterized by pain in the head associated with heat around the head. It is explained by increased vali. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram and Cennīr gets affected.

Short_definition: Dryness over the scalp classified under Vali

Long_definition: It is characterized by heaviness in head associated with blurred vision, pain in the occipital region, puffiness of the face. It is explained by increased vali. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram and Cennīr gets affected.

Short_definition: Brain diseases due to increasing Vali
Long_definition: It is characterized by brain disease associated with chillness of the head, ear block and headache. It is explained by increased vali. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram, Cennīr, Ūṉ, and Koẕuppu gets affected.

Short_definition: Brain diseases due to increasingvali iyam
Long_definition: It is characterized by brain disease associated with hyperhydrosis, pain, fever, cough, face and eyes are pallor. It is explained by increased vali associated with aiyyam. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram, Cennīr, Ūṉ,and Koẕuppu gets affected.

It is characterized by brain disease associated with dryness of the nose, ears, eyes, pricking pain. It is explained by increased vali. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram, Cennīr, Ūṉ and Koẕuppu gets affected.

Short_definition: Brain diseases due to increasing Vali azhal
Long_definition: It is characterized by brain disease associated with pain in the occipital region, cough, blurred vision. It is explained by increased vali associated with Aẕal. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram, Cennīr, Ūṉ and Koẕuppu gets affected.

Short_definition: Brain diseases due to increasing Azhal Aiyam
Long_definition: It is characterized by a brain disease associated with cough, hiccup, fever. It is explained by increased Aẕal associated aiyam. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram, Cennīr, Ūṉ, and Koẕuppu gets affected.

Short_definition: Brain diseases due to increasing Azhal
Long_definition: It is characterized by brain disease associated with pallor, rhinitis. It is explained by increased Aẕal. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram, Cennīr, Ūṉ and Koẕuppu gets affected.

Short_definition: Brain diseases due to increasing Azhal associated with blood infection
Long_definition: It is characterized by brain disease associated with epistaxis, hyphema, heaviness in head. It is explained by increased Aẕal. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram, Cennīr, Ūṉ and Koẕuppu gets affected.

Short_definition: Brain diseases due to increasing Aiyam
Long_definition: It is characterized by brain disease associated with cough, sweetness of the tongue, throat infection. It is explained by increased aiyam. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram, Cennīr, Ūṉ and Koẕuppu gets affected.

Short_definition: Brain diseases due to increasing Aiyam vali
Long_definition: It is characterized by brain disease associated with rhinitis, swelling in the face, pricking pain, hairfall, cough. It is explained by increased aiyam, along with vali. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram, Cennīr, Ūṉ and Koẕuppu gets affected.

Long_definition: It is characterised by recurrent dislocation of shoulder joint in anterior side caused by lack of immobilisation and weakness of shoulder muscles.

The dislocation of shoulder joint on posterior side caused by falling in flexed and adduction of hand. It is characterised by severe pain, patient will hold the affected hand in adduction position wit other hand, flattening of anterior side of shoulder, p
The dislocation of shoulder joint on inferior side caused by hyper abduction and extension of shoulder and characterised by protrusion of humerus head below glenoid cavity.

A break in proximal part of humerus caused by falling in out-stretched hand, injury to lateral side of humerus. It is characterised by pain and swelling in affected site, restricted shoulder movements

Short_definition: Fracture of the shaft of the humerus
Long_definition: A break in the shaft of the Humreus caused by falling in out-stretched hand and direct injury. It is characterised by pain and swelling at fracture site, abnormal mobility in upper arm, if fracture at spiral groove can cause wrist drop.

Short_definition: Fractures of distal end of humerus
Long_definition: A break in the distal end of humerus caused by falling on outstretched hand with hyerextension. It is characterised by pain and swelling in elbow, tenderness, restricted movements, shortening of upper arm, but no change in forearm length, maintaining tria
A dislocation of elbow on anterior or posterior lateral, postero-medial, medial, posterior, lateral or divergent side caused by falling on flexed elbow position.
A dislocation to elbow along with fragment fracture of associated bone in elbow. It is characterised by pain and swelling in affected site, altered relationship of bony triangle
A dislocation of radial head caused by pulling of elbow. It is characterised by pain and swelling in affected site, difficult to lift the hand, tenderness over radial side of elbow

Short_definition: Fracture of proximal end of ulna
Long_definition: A break in olecranon process caused by direct injury and severe contractions of triceps. It is characterised by pain and swelling in affected site, tenderness, crepitus and difficult in extension of elbow.

Short_definition: Fractures of the proximal end of the radius
Long_definition: A break in the head of the radius or neck of the radius caused by direct injury and falling on out-stretched hand. It is characterised by pain and swelling in elbow

Term: Ārai Maṟṟum Irattiṉi - Iru Elumputtaṇṭu Muṟivukaḷ
RegionalTerm: ஆரை மற்றும் இரத்தினி - இரு எலும்புத்தண்டு முறிவுகள்
Long_definition: A break in shaft of both ulna and radius caused by falling on out strectched hand, direct injury characterised by pain, swelling of affected site, restricted movements of elbow.
A break in shaft of radius
A break in the shaft of ulna
A break in lower end of radius bone caused by falling on outstretched hand with dorsiflexion characterised by pain and swelling at affected site, deformity of wrist.
A break in the Scaphoid bone
A break in the lunate bone
A break in the triquetral bone
A break in the pisiform bone
A break in the hamate bone
A break in the capitate bone
A break in the trapezoid bone
A break in the trapezium bone
A break in head, neck, shaft and distal end of metacarpal bone
A break in head, neck, shaft and distal end of phalanges.

A dislocation of head of femur from acetabulum in posterior, anterior and central side caused by dashboard injury. It is characterized by pain and swelling in affected side, shortening of leg, protrusion of femoral head in buttocks leading to sciatic nerv
A break in head of femur caused by pressure by axial load.

Short_definition: Fracture of the neck of the femur
Long_definition: A break in the neck of the femur caused by falling on lateral side hitting greater trochanter characterized by pain and swelling in hip, inability to walk, protrusion of greater trochanter
A break in proximal end of femur

Short_definition: Fracture of the shaft of the femur
Long_definition: A break in sub trochanter, supracondylar area of the shaft of the femur caused by strong direct trauma characterized by pain and swelling in thigh, excessive bleeding and shortening of leg
A break in femoral condyle caused by falling on valgus or varus or rotation leg position. It is characterized by pain and swelling around affected knee and flexion deformit
A break in the patella caused by direct injury and indirect trauma characterized by pain ans swelling around the knee, crepitus, difficulty in flexion and extension of knee
A dislocation of patella
A dislocation of knee
A break on proximal end of tibia caused by dashboard injury characterized by pain, swelling hemoarthrosis and restricted movements

Short_definition: Fractures of shaft of tibia and fibula
Long_definition: A break in the shaft of tibia and fibula.
A break in distal end of tibial fracture caused by falling from high altitude producing axial or vertical compression characterized by pain, swelling of the affected site and difficulty to stand.
A break in bones associated with ankle joint caused by adduction, inversion, abduction, eversion and vertical compression characterised by pain and swelling and tenderness.
A break in cuboid bone
A break in navicular bone
A break in cuneiform bone
A break in head, neck and shaft of metatarsal bone
A break in phalanges
A break in cervical spine

Short_definition: injuries of Thoracic and Lumbar spine

Long_definition: A break in the thoracic spine
A break in T5-T6 thoracic spine
A break in the upper thoraic spines
A break in T12 spine
A break in Lumbar spine
A break in transverse process of spine
A break in the acetabulum of hip
A break in the sacrum
A break in the coccyx

Short_definition: fracture of the upper thoracic T1-T7 costovertebral joint
Long_definition: A break in upper thoracic costovertebral joints

Short_definition: fracture of the manubrium of sternum
Long_definition: A break in manubrium of sternum
A break in bones of skull
A break in nasal bone

It is characterised by loss of taste which may be associated with loss of smell, anorexia, increased secretion of saliva. This may be explained by: (a) Impairment of digestive and metabolic factors affecting kapha residing on the tongue.
It is characterised by atony or flaccidity of the joints, muscles and body parts. This may be explained by: (a) Obstructed or aggravated vata causes loss of functions, flaccidity.
It is characterised by irrelevant and irrational talk, mental confusion. This may be explained by: (a) Vitiation of Vata affecting motor and intellectual faculties.
It is characterised by difficulty to concentrate, fickleness, confusion. This may be explained by: (a) Vitiation of vata affecting the mind.
It is characterized by abdominal pain and increased gaseous movements in abdomen. This may be explained by aggravation of vatadosha at its designated site and preparing to cause certain morbidity.

It is characterized by impaired movements of vāta, fullness of abdomen and aversion to factors causing of increase of vāta such as cold. This may be explained by accumulation of vatadosha at the designated site to a moderate level resulting in accumulation.

It is characterized by roughness or hoarseness of voice, emaciation, blackish discoloration of body, twitching in various parts of body, desire for warmth, insomnia, reduced physical strength, hard stools. This may be explained by marked increase of vatadosha functions and consequent physiological and pathological ramifications.

It is characterized by abnormal movements of vāta, abdominal distension and gurgling sound in the abdomen. This may be explained by spreading of vatadosha from place of accumulation to other parts or entire body.

It is characterized by sluggishness in activities, reduced talking, lack of interest in activities, loss of consciousness. This may be explained by marked decrease of vatadosha functions and consequent physiological and pathological ramifications.

It is characterised tooth sensitivity usually due to worn tooth enamel, tooth decay, broken teethm and gum recession. It is explained by increased vali and Aẕal. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Eṉpu thadhu gets affected.

It is characterised by weak, shaky tooth due to erosion of enamel. It is explained by increased vali humour. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Eṉpu thadhu gets weakened.

It is characterised by removal of tooth or tooth roots with minimal trauma to the surrounding tissues. It is explained by increased vali humour. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Eṉpu thadhu gets affected.

It is characterised by the growth of third or final set of molar teeth in late teenage. It is explained by increased vali, Aẕal and aiya humour. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ there is an increase in Eṉpu thadhu.
It is characterised by chipping of small pieces of teeth or enamel. It is explained by increased decreased vali. Among the Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Eṉpu is increased.
It is characterised by shedding of teeth which is both physiological and pathological. It is explained by increased vali. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ there is decrease in Eṉpu thadhu.
It is characterised by blackish discoloration of teeth. It is explained by increased vali humour. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cennīr and Ūṉ gets affected.

It is characterised by hole in teeth near the gum line mainly due to dental caries. It is explained by increased vali humour. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ there is decreased activity of Eṉpu thadhu.
It is characterised by small white patches in cheeks, gums. It is explained by deranged vali and aiyam. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cennīr gets affected.

It is characterised by discoloration of the gums either black, grey or white or purple due to varied physiological or pathological conditions. It is explained by increased vali humour. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram and Cennīr gets affected.

It is characterised by exposure of roots of the teeth caused by loss of gum tissue. It is also called as receding gums. It is explained by increased vali. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Koẕuppu and Eṉpu thadhu gets affected.

It is characterised by hardened plaques attached to the gums causing dark patches. Melanoma may cause dark spots in mouth. It is explained by increased vali. Among seven the Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cennīr thadhu gets affected.

It is characterised by irreversible loss of tooth structure due to chemical dissolution by acids and not of infection. It is explained by increased vali. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ there is decresase activity of Eṉpu thadhu.

It is characterised by inflammation of the gums usually by bacterial infection. It is a non-destructive disease that occurs around the teeth. There may be bleeding and plaques in gums, bad breath, receding and tender gums, red swollen and puffy gums. It i

It is characterised by a sticky biofilm that coats the teeth and contains bacteria, yellowish discolouration of teeth. It is explained by increased Aẕal. Among the seven udarthadhukal Cāram and Eṉpu gets affected.

It is characterised by collection of pus in an abscess within the tissue of the perodentium. It is explained by increased Aẕal causing increased vali. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram, Cennīr, Ūṉ , Koẕuppu and Eṉpu gets affected.
